description: I love chai tea, I'm addicted to the taste of starbucks chai but occasionally I do Peet's as the 2nd best.  Peets does better pastries however.  They've got a lot of great coffee/tea gift items.  I'm a big fan of their bagged tea boxes.  The staff here is very friendly.  My mother once broke the lid on an item she was looking at and they didn't make her pay for it.  In fact they gave it to her for free because she was so embarrassed.  I've made sure to tip generously here ever since then. On the downside there is never any seating and the toilet could be cleaner.
author: Michael D.

description: Friendly staff here, clean restroom, good location. Plus, there's a faux-old poster near the restroom that reminds me of a Fu Manchu novel. And really, can you ever get enough Fu Manchu?
author: Johnny O.

description: I am in love with Peet's.  They have the best coffee, the best tea and locations everywhere so you're never too far from your next fix.   The Castro/Market Street location is my favorite because the staff is friendly and there's always an interesting crowd buzzing around - especially on the weekends.   A Peet's latte with an extra shot and the devil's food cupcake with raspberry frosting can turn any day around!
author: Valerie D.

description: If for some reason you're keeping up with my Peet's reviews, you might have noticed that I have about five "favorite Peet's" locations... well, make that six.
author: Alex C.

description: this is my favorite peets.   the staff is friendly even when it's jammed.   i have a finicky order and they take care to do it right.    it seems that they try to remember names and stay calm and warm when the line is out the door.   there's a good reason it is a crowded shop
author: carmela g.

description:
Peet's is the standard by which I measure every cup of brewed coffee I drink anywhere else. And I drink it at home. Need I say more?

(in case you think I *should* say more, read my other coffee reviews... I'm a gal who knows--and loves her coffee.)

My favorite feature about the Castro Peet's is the "Customer of the Week" award... I hope this encourages people to treat those hard-working baristas very, very well.
author: Jackie C.

description: I am upgrading my review of Peet's to 5 stars because it was the first place I went when I got back from a very stressful trip home to MA. and seeing the staff there was a refreshing reminder that I was home.  They are all super friendly, the manager is SO nice and professional, and they can bust through a long line in a matter of minutes.  I don't have a single negative thing to say about this Peet's, or any other I've been to for that matter.  Compared to the taste of Starbucks coffee and the difference in the "coffee buzz" I say Peet's has it hands down.  @ The poster who ordered the "sugar free nonfat extra vanilla supercalafragalisticexpealadocious latte, all I have to say is, I order a small coffee and you people piss me off sometimes lol.  (A friendly jeer).
author: Jonathan M.

description:
peet's is the only chain that serves a good cup of coffee.  this location in the castro is by far my favorite.  i worked across the street from there and I'd have to say that everyone working there is extremely friendly.  and even though there's always a ridiculously long line there, you never have to wait too long. 

the guy with curly, long, red hair at the register is super cute.  get me the digits.
author: rachface -.

description: I love getting my coffee here -- the Italian Roast -- YUM. Sure, it's expensive, but they're all so nice, and they give you a free cup of coffee with a purchase of beans.  That's like getting a $2 discount, right?
author: S S.

description: Finally reviewing this place because they have free wi-fi for 2 hours.  And, I like the lay out, as well as the great service I always get here.  More pumpkin latte, please!
author: Tiberius A.

description: I am a huge fan of Peet's Coffee and have been for many years. Wonderful tasty strong coffee. Great cappucino: the best in town. Staff can be friendly or reserved, but give them a break: they are serving coffee and making latte  ALL day long. If Peet's was not in my neighborhood, I would walk an extra mile to avoid starbucks and find Peet's. Support local businesses!
author: Frances G.

description: I really enjoy Peet's Coffee, but this locations employees are something. Walked in and there was no one in line but definitely people waiting for there drinks. There was one working the bar def saw me and soon there was another one again def saw me. No one acknowledge that I was even there. After waiting another two minutes, again not even an acknowledgement I left. I understand people can be busy, but there is no reason to be ignored. Shoot Starbucks the corporate giant has even figured that one out. Def won't be back.
author: Brian B.

description: I hate this place...They got my drink wrong and not only that the register guy made fun of me and gave me and my friends a hard time. Another employee even said behind the bar something along the lines of, " What do these people think; we are not Starbucks!" Trust me my drink was just a white mocha made with soy milk and that's is nothing to elaborate then a simple coffee drink! I never complained or said a thing and did not give a tip and even through my drink away in the trash where they can see me doing it and my friends and I walked out upset! This is not a friendly location and the drinks are horrible!
author: Michael H.

description:
The best out of chain coffee houses.
Layout is great, always clean and staff is typically very fast.
They do have some who would rather chat with "the boys" and oftentimes you'll come across a queen in line who just doesn't realise that there are other people in line, so that's annoying.
But it doesn't ruin a good experience which has become part of my schedule, I love getting my half-decaf mocha here :)
author: Alex S.

description: Definitely my favorite coffee shop!  Plus it's easy to grab one and run over to Hairworks to have Jack do his magic ;)
author: Kim O.

description: Sometimes I think it is silly to rate chain places like Peet's, because the company strives to create a relatively similar experience at all locations so that customers know what they are going to get, from who, etc.  But this Peet's is my favorite of the locations that I often visit (also, West Portal and the Berkeley location on Telegraph and Dwight).  The baristas are always so so sweet, especially the tall guy with the red hair and lovely beard (if you are reading this, heyyyy guy!).  Their cappucino is also really good.  This particular Peet's is generally really crowded, which makes it a challenge to score an outlet, but I am usually lucky enough to sit at the counter that faces Market.  I love watching all the doggies and humans taking strolls, socializing and sniffin' butts (the doggies).  I also really love the crowd.  I am usually the only woman in the place, but I feel so safe and cozy among all those totally perfect, beautiful, buff dudes.
author: Christie S.

description: i'm sorry but their chai stinks... i've heard their coffee is okay though.
author: AJ M.

description: True San Francisco coffee... making pretty much every other cup in the city needing 2+ shots of expresso to keep up. This castro location is always hopping and is quite the interesting gayborhood people watching spot. The staff at this location is incredibly friendly location, making an already fantastic place a true "Peetnicks" paradise.
author: Michael H.

description: sexy staff. excellent coffee. no half & half....
author: cristy g.
